intro: Antacanthus sprengelii, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and small, glandular hairs on the foliage. Antacanthus sprengelii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
